meanings.definition: The act of performing menial tasks or chores.
meanings.sent1: At the office, dogsbodying involves filing paperwork and making coffee for everyone.
meanings.sent2: She was tired of always being stuck with the dogsbodying while others got to do more exciting projects.
meanings.sent3: The dogsbodying duties seemed never-ending, but she tackled them with a smile.
meanings.sent4: In the play, the character's dogsbodying symbolized the monotony of everyday life.
meanings.sent5: The dogsbodying tasks piled up like a mountain, overwhelming her with their sheer number.

meanings.definition: Someone who is assigned to do unpleasant or boring work.
meanings.sent1: As the new intern, he was often seen as the dogsbodying of the team.
meanings.sent2: The dogsbodying of cleaning the toilets was always left to the newest employee.
meanings.sent3: Despite being the dogsbodying, he found ways to make the work more enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a dogsbodying, constantly overlooked for more interesting tasks.
meanings.sent5: The dogsbodying of the group, he was always the one to take on the least desirable jobs.
